bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 93 (Friday, May 27, 2022)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. ESPAILLAT:H.R. 7885.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Section 5 of Amendment XIV of the U.S. Constitution.[Page H5220]

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Opportunity.
Referred to the House Committee on Veterans' Affairs.

bill.title: Protect Veteran Students, Job Seekers, and Entrepreneurs Housing Act

item.title: Protect Veteran Students, Job Seekers, and Entrepreneurs Housing Act
Protect Veteran Students, Job Seekers, and Entrepreneurs Housing Act

To amend the Servicemembers Civil Relief Act to ensure that certain education and workforce development benefits administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs are treated as income by landlords evaluating the ability of a servicemember, veteran, or a spouse or child of a servicemember or veteran, to pay rent, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Opportunity.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
